topic.title: Creating Multiple User Accounts in Bulk

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: You can create multiple user accounts at once by importing a predefined Excel template; the template and import process are documented here.

context.p: You can create multiple user accounts at once by importing a Microsoft Excel file that contains user details. The high-level process of bulk uploading of user account details is as follows:

ol.li: Download the predefined Excel template from . The Excel template contains user information required for user account creation as columns.
Enter user account details in the template workbook.
Import the workbook with user details to .

context.p: The password for user accounts created by importing account information using an Excel file is set to Mind@123. All users with accounts created using the bulk import feature can log in to the application with their username and the default password Mind@123. Users are prompted to reset their password on the first login.

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
In the navigation pane, expand User Management, and then click User Accounts.
The USER ACCOUNTS list page is displayed.
Click Excel Import / Export, and then click Excel Template.
The template is saved to your local storage.
Open the saved Excel template workbook.
Enter information for each of the columns, as described in the following table.

row.entry:
Do not enter information in the InternalID column.
When you import the Excel workbook, a unique identification code for the corresponding user record is automatically generated.
Enter a unique alphanumeric name to identify the user.
Enter the first name of the user.
Enter the middle name of the user.
Enter the last name of the user.
Enter the company name of the user.
Enter the address of the user.
Enter the name of the city where the user resides.
Enter the name of the state where the user resides.
Enter the name of the country where the user resides.
Enter the zip code for the address where the user resides.
Enter the telephone number of the user.
Enter the email address of the user for email communication.
Enter the fax number of the user for facsimile communication.
Enter the access certificate number assigned to the user.

Enter either of the following options:
Internal - Enter this option if the user belongs to the organization.
External - Enter this option if the user belongs to a different organization. For example, contractors.

entry.p: If the Type is External, then enter the vendor associated with the user.
To view the list of vendors, refer to the Vendors catalog of the library.

row.entry:
Enter YES to specify that the user is active.
Enter NO to deny application access to the user. To revoke application access from a user, change the status of the user to Inactive. For information on changing the status of a user, refer to Deactivating a User Account.
Enter the mobile number of the user.

Enter the date until which the account will be active.
Enter the date in the format as defined in the USER SETTINGS
USER SETTINGS page. The user is denied access to the application after this date.
Enter YES for the user to receive an email notification with login details on user account creation.

Enter the role names for the user separated by a comma. Ensure the role names entered here are as defined in the application.
To view the list of role names defined in the application, in the Administration navigation pane, expand User Management, and then click Security Roles.

Enter the business units to which the user belongs. Enter the business unit names separated by a comma. Ensure the business unit names entered here are as defined in the application.
To view the list of business unit names defined in the application, in the navigation pane, expand Functional Configuration, and then click Business Units.

This column is available only if the option selected in the Login Mode field in the AUTHENTICATION & LOGIN SETTINGS page is External IDP or Mixed.Enter YES if the user is registered in the External Identity Provider. Else, enter No.

li.p: To import the Excel workbook with user details, click Excel Import / Export, and then click Excel Import.
The IMPORT DETAILS FROM EXCEL FILE page is displayed.
The Open dialog box is displayed.
Select the workbook with the updated information,and then click Open.
The information in the Excel file is displayed.
The information in the Excel file is imported to .
